hackathon-description-text: We are GreatUniHack, an annual 24-hour student-oriented hackathon organised by the University of Manchester tech society, HackSoc.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: A fun and innovative real time digital travel companion. We aren’t looking for the next TripAdvisor or FlightRadar24. We’re looking for something surprising that will make us smile when we’re next on the go. To get you thinking, a good set of open data sources is at
Build something to help young people engage with programming.
Best financial hack. Solutions will be judged on: Innovation, User Experience, Functionality, Content and Overall quality.

Design a 3D packing algorithm that uses a list of grocery items to calculate the number of containers required for a customer order, grouping the items into specific containers according to a set of predefined rules. The output will also contain a list of picking sequences which will describe which items from which order will go into which container based on the rules provided. More info:

Build a tool to help customer service agents at THG prioritise and categorise customer emails, using NLP tools/techniques. Is the customer making a complaint? Is it a question about a product? Which of our websites are they talking about? Use any libraries/APIs you like. Should be able to analyse at least English, with other languages optional.
Create a hack to make the world a better place, i.e. by considering inclusion and the needs of diverse range of users etc. More info:
The best/most creative use of Skyscanner's API.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
